title: 3 Easy Ways to Check Instagram Login Devices + Delete Them

steps.title: Tap your profile icon in the Instagram app.
steps.content: Tap your profile icon in the Instagram app. You'll see it in the bottom-right corner of the screen.

steps.title: Tap ☰.
steps.content: Tap ☰ . This three-line menu icon is in the top-right corner of your screen.

steps.title: Tap Accounts Center.
steps.content: Tap Accounts Center . This is at the very top of the page.

steps.title: Tap Password and security.
steps.content: Tap Password and security . You can find this towards the middle of the page, underneath the Account settings header.

steps.title: Tap Where you're logged in.
steps.content: Tap Where you're logged in . This is under the Security checks header.

steps.title: Tap your account.
steps.content: Tap your account. A new page will open with your login activity.

steps.title: View your login activity.
steps.content: View your login activity. You'll see your current activity and logins on other devices. [1] X Research source To sign out of devices, tap Select devices to log out . Tap each device, and then tap Log out at the bottom.

steps.title: Click ☰.
steps.content: Click ☰ . You can find this on the left sidebar of Instagram on the web. A pop-up menu will open. If you aren't already logged in , enter your email address or username and password to do so now.

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . This is at the top of the menu.

steps.title: Click Accounts Center.
steps.content: Click Accounts Center . This is the tile on the left side, underneath the Settings header. A new page will open.

steps.title: Click Password and security.
steps.content: Click Password and security . You can find this in the left panel, underneath the Account settings header.

steps.title: Click Where you're logged in.
steps.content: Click Where you're logged in . This is under the Security checks header.

steps.title: Click your account.
steps.content: Click your account. A new page will open with your login activity.

steps.title: View your login activity.
steps.content: View your login activity. You'll see your current activity and logins on other devices. To sign out of devices, click Select devices to log out . Click each device, and then click Log out at the bottom.

steps.title: Enable two-factor authentication.
steps.content: Enable two-factor authentication. This feature can protect your account by requiring a unique code when logging in from unknown devices. [2] X Research source To enable it, do the following: Select ☰ . Select Settings . Select Accounts Center . Select Password and security . Select Two-factor authentication and select your account. Select a security method.

steps.title: Enable login requests.
steps.content: Enable login requests. When this is on, you may get notifications if a device logs into your Instagram account as well as where the login originated. This feature can only be enabled if you have two-factor authentication. Do the following: Select ☰ . Select Settings . Select Accounts Center . Select Password and security . Select Two-factor authentication . Toggle on Login requests .
